intro: Mapania pycnocephala subsp. pycnocephala, commonly known as the dense-headed mapania, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its tightly packed, dark purple to black flower heads, which are densely covered in tiny florets. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and is occasionally cultivated for its striking appearance.
